analyzed: tārā ākhyā devatā khyātā caturvarga phala pradā

original: klīṃ bījaṃ cakṣuṣormadhye sarvāṅgaṃ me sadāvatu /🔽aiṃ bījaṃ me mukhaṃ pātu hrīṃ jihvāṃ parirakṣatu /

analyzed: yūṅkāraḥ vāma pārśvam ca sakāraḥ merum eva ca

original: hesaurliṅgañca lomāni keśañca parirakṣatu /🔽aiṃ bījaṃ pātu pūrve me hrīṃ bījaṃ dakṣiṇe'vatu /🔽śrīṃ bījaṃ paścime pātu uttare bhūtasambhavam /
analyzed: hesauḥ liṅgam ca lomāni keśam ca parirakṣatu  aim bījam pātu pūrve me hrīṃ bījam dakṣiṇā ivatu  śrīṃ bījam paścime pātu uttare bhūta sambhavam
translated: The letter Hsa may protect my genitals, hair, and head.🔽The seed syllable Aim may protect my east, the seed syllable Hrim may protect my south.🔽The seed syllable Shrim may protect my west, the seed syllable Bhut may protect my north.

analyzed: ye te daridrāḥ satataḥ hi mātar tvadīya pādam manasā namanti

original: devāsurāḥ siddhavarāśca sarve tava prasādāt satataṃ luṭhanti //
analyzed: deva asurāḥ siddha varāḥ ca sarve tava prasādāt satatam luṭhanti
translated: all the gods, demons, and excellent Siddhas, constantly roll about due to your grace.

original: haristvatpādābjaṃ nikhilajagatāṃ bhūtirabhavat śivo dhyātvā dhyātvā kimapi paramaṃ
analyzed: hariḥ tvad pāda abjam nikhila jagatām bhūtiḥ abhavat śivaḥ dhyātvā dhyātvā kim api paramam
translated: Hari became the lotus of your feet, the prosperity of all worlds. Shiva, meditating and meditating on that supreme,

original: tatparataram /🔽prajānāṃ nātho'yaṃ tadanu jagatāṃ sṛṣṭivihitaṃ kimanyatte mātastava caraṇayugmasya
analyzed: tad parataram  prajānām nāthaḥ ūyam tadanu jagatām sṛṣṭi vihitam kim anyat te mātar tava caraṇa yugmasya
translated: more than that,

analyzed: phala tā
translated: this lord of beings, after that, created the world. What else, O Mother, is the fruit of your pair of feet?

original: indraḥ surāṇāṃ śaraṇaṃ śaraṇye / prajāpatiḥ kāśyapa eva nānyaḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ surāṇām śaraṇam śaraṇye prajāpatiḥ kāśyapaḥ eva na anyaḥ
translated: Indra is the refuge of the gods, O you who are worthy of refuge. Prajapati is none other than Kashyapa himself.

analyzed: varaḥ patiḥ viṣṇu bhavaḥ para īśi tvadīya pāda abja phalam samastam
translated: The best husband is Vishnu, the lord of the highest goddess. The entire fruit of your lotus feet is

analyzed: tvadīya nābhī nava pallave vā nava aṅkuraiḥ lomavaraiḥ praphullam
translated: In the new sprout of your navel, or in the excellent new sprouts of your body hair, which are in full bloom.

original: sadā vareṇye / śaraṇaṃ vidhehi kiṃvāparaṃ cittavarairvibhāvyam /🔽tvadīyapādārcitavastusambhavaḥ surāsuraiḥ pūjyamavāpa śambhuḥ /
analyzed: sadā vareṇye śaraṇam vidhehi kiṃvā aparam citta varaiḥ vibhāvyam  tvadīya pāda arcita vastu sambhavaḥ sura asuraiḥ pūjyam avāpa śambhuḥ
translated: O always venerable one! Please grant me refuge. What else can be contemplated by the best of minds?🔽The one who worships the objects worshipped at your feet, attained Shiva, who is worshipped by gods and demons.

analyzed: tvadīya pāda arccana tatparaḥ hariḥ sudarśana adhīśvara tām upālabhat
translated: The one who is devoted to worshipping your feet, Hari, reproached Sudarshana for being the lord of the world.

original: dharitrī gandharūpeṇa rasena ca jalaṃ dhṛtam /
analyzed: dharitrī gandha rūpeṇa rasena ca jalam dhṛtam
translated: The earth is held by you in the form of smell, and water by taste.

analyzed: tejaḥ vahni sva rūpena praṇave brahma rūpa dhṛk
translated: Fire is held by you in the form of light, and Brahman is held by you in the form of Pranava.

original: mukhaṃ candrākāraṃ tribhuvanapade yāmasahitaṃ trinetraṃ me mātaḥ / pariharati yaḥ
analyzed: mukham candra ākāram tribhuvana pade yāma sahitam trinetram me mātar pariharati yaḥ
translated: O Mother! The one who avoids the face which is in the form of the moon, the three worlds, the one accompanied by Yama, the three-eyed one,

analyzed: syāt sa tu paśuḥ
translated: he would be an animal.

original: na siddhistasya syāt suratasatataṃ viśvamakhilaṃ kaṭākṣaiste mātaḥ /
analyzed: na siddhiḥ tasya syāt surata satatam viśvam akhilam kaṭākṣaiḥ te mātar
translated: He would not attain success, O Mother! The entire universe is always successful by your sidelong glances.

original: saphalapadapadmaṃ sa labhate //🔽kratustvaṃ havistvaṃ svadhā tvaṃ murāreḥ purā tvaṃ parā tvaṃ sadāśīrmurāreḥ /
analyzed: sa phala pada padmam sa labhate  kratuḥ tvam haviḥ tvam svadhā tvam murāreḥ purā tvam parā tvam sadā āśīḥ murāreḥ
translated: He attains the lotus feet with fruitful steps.🔽You are the sacrifice, you are the oblation, you are the Svāhā, you are the supreme one of Murāri (Viṣṇu) in ancient times, you are the eternal one of Murāri.

original: harastvaṃ haristvaṃ śivastvaṃ śivānāṃ gatistvaṃ gatistvaṃ gatistvaṃ bhavāni / //
analyzed: haraḥ tvam hariḥ tvam śivaḥ tvam śivānām gatiḥ tvam gatiḥ tvam gatiḥ tvam bhavāni
translated: You are Hara (Śiva), you are Hari (Viṣṇu), you are Śiva, you are the goal of the auspicious ones, you are the goal, you are the goal, O Bhavani.

original: navāhaṃ navā tvaṃ navā vā kriyāyā varastvaṃ carustvaṃ śaraṇyaṃ dharāyāḥ /
analyzed: navā aham navā tvam navā vā kriyāyāḥ varaḥ tvam caruḥ tvam śaraṇyam dharāyāḥ
translated: You are the nine, the new, the nine, the best of actions, you are the oblation, you are the refuge of the earth.

original: nadastvaṃ nadī tvaṃ gatistvaṃ nidhīnāṃ sutastvaṃ sutā tvaṃ pitā tvaṃ gṛhiṇām //
analyzed: nadaḥ tvam nadī tvam gatiḥ tvam nidhīnām sutaḥ tvam sutā tvam pitā tvam gṛhiṇām
translated: You are the rivers, you are the river, you are the refuge of the treasures, you are the son, you are the daughter, you are the father of the householders.

original: tvadīyamuṇḍākhya bhavāni / mālāṃ vidhāya citte bhavapadmajādayaḥ /
analyzed: tvadīya muṇḍa ākhya bhavāni mālām vidhāya citte bhava padmaja ādayaḥ
translated: Having placed the garland named your hair, O Bhavani, in the mind, the lotus-born Brahma and others

original: surādhipatvaṃ labhate munīndraḥ śaraṇyametat kimapīha cānyat /
analyzed: sura adhipa tvam labhate muni indraḥ śaraṇyam etat kim api iha ca anyat
translated: attain the lordship of the gods, the lord of sages is the refuge, this is indeed something else here.

original: narasya muṇḍañca tathā hi khaḍgaṃ bhujadvaye ye manasā japanti /
analyzed: narasya muṇḍam ca tathā hi khaḍgam bhuja dvaye ye manasā japanti
translated: Those who mentally recite the sword and the shaven head of a man on both arms,

original: savyetare devi / varābhayañca bhavanti te siddhajanā munīndrāḥ /
analyzed: savyetare devi bhavanti te siddha janāḥ muni indrāḥ
translated: O Goddess, on the right and left, and the boon and protection, they become accomplished people, lords of sages.

original: śivopari tvāṃ hṛdaye nidhāya japanti vidyāṃ hṛdaye kadācit /
analyzed: śiva upari tvām hṛdaye nidhāya japanti vidyām hṛdaye kadācid
translated: Placing you above Shiva in the heart, they sometimes recite the knowledge in the heart.

original: p / sadā bhavet kāvyarasasya vettā ante padadvandvamupāśrayeta //
analyzed: sadā bhavet kāvya rasasya vettā ante pada dvandvam upāśrayeta
translated: He should always be the knower of the essence of poetry, and in the end, he should resort to the couple of feet.

original: digambarīṃ tvāṃ manasā vicintya japet parākhyāṃ jagatāṃ janīti /
analyzed: digambarīm tvām manasā vicintya japet parākhyām jagatām janī iti
translated: Contemplating you, the naked one, in the mind, he should recite the knowledge known as supreme, the birth of the worlds.

original: japetparākhyāṃ jagatāṃ matiśca kiṃvā parākhyāśaraṇaṃ bhavāmaḥ /
analyzed: japet para ākhyām jagatām matiḥ ca kiṃvā para ākhyā śaraṇam bhavāmaḥ
translated: The mind should recite the supreme knowledge of the worlds. Or, should we take refuge in the supreme knowledge?

original: śivāvirāvaiḥ pariveṣṭitāṃ tvāṃ nidhāya citte satataṃ japanti /
analyzed: śivā virāvaiḥ pariveṣṭitām tvām nidhāya citte satatam japanti
translated: Placing you, surrounded by the howls of jackals, in their minds, they constantly chant.

original: bhaveya deveśi / parāparādinirīśatāṃ devi / parā vadandi //
analyzed: bhaveya deveśi parāpara ādi nirīśa tām devi parā
translated: O Goddess of gods, O supreme and inferior, O Goddess, grant me the state of being the foremost.

original: tvadīyaśṛṅgārarasaṃ nidhāya japanti mantraṃ yadi vedamukhyāḥ /
analyzed: tvadīya śṛṅgāra rasam nidhāya japanti mantram yadi veda mukhyāḥ
translated: If the Vedas and other scriptures, placing your amorous essence, chant the mantra,

original: bhavanti te devi / janāpavādaṃ kaviḥ kavīnāmapi cāgrajanmā //
analyzed: bhavanti te devi jana apavādam kaviḥ kavīnām api ca agrajanmā
translated: O Goddess, those people become the object of slander, and the poet is the eldest among poets.

original: vikīrṇaveśāṃ manasā nidhāya japanti vidyāṃ cakitaṃ kadācit /
analyzed: vikīrṇa veśām manasā nidhāya japanti vidyām cakitam kadācid
translated: Placing you, with disheveled attire, in the mind, they sometimes chant the Vidyā with fear.

original: sudhādhipatyaṃ labhate naraḥ sa kimasti bhūmyāṃ sṛṇu kālakāli / //
analyzed: sudhā ādhipatyam labhate naraḥ sa kim asti bhūmyām sṛṇu kālakāli
translated: That man obtains the lordship of nectar. Is it on earth? Listen, O Kālakālī.

analyzed: tvadīya vīja traya mātar etat japanti siddhāḥ tu vimukti hetoḥ
translated: The Siddhas chant this essence of your three seed syllables for the sake of liberation.

original: tadeva mātastava pādapadmagā bhavanti siddhiśca dinatraye'pi //
analyzed: tat eva mātar tava pāda padma gāḥ bhavanti siddhiḥ ca dina traye pi
translated: O Mother, they become devoted to your lotus feet and attain Siddhi in three days.

analyzed: tvadīya kūrcca dvaya jāpaka tvāt sura asurebhyaḥ api bhavet ca varṇaḥ
translated: By chanting your two Kūrcchās, one becomes superior even to the gods and demons.

original: dhanitvapāṇḍityamayanti sarve kiṃ vā parāṃ devi / parāparākhyā //
analyzed: dhani tva pāṇḍityam ayanti sarve kim vā parām devi parāpara ākhyā
translated: All of them attain wealth and scholarship. Or what is the supreme, O Goddess, known as Parāparā?

analyzed: tvadīya lajjā dvaya jāpaka tvāt bhavet maheśāni caturtha siddhiḥ
translated: By chanting your two Lajjā syllables, O Maheśānī, one attains the fourth Siddhi.

analyzed: tvadīya sat siddhi vara prasādāt tava ādhipatyam labhate nareśaḥ
translated: By the grace of your excellent accomplishments, the king attains lordship over you.

original: tataḥ svanāmnaḥ śṛṇu mātaretat phalaṃ caturvarga vadanti santaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sva nāmnaḥ śṛṇu mātar etat phalam caturvarga vadanti santaḥ
translated: Then, O Mother, listen to this fruit of your own name, which the wise say is the four goals of life.

original: vījatrayaṃ vai punarapyu pāsya surādhipatyaṃ labhate munīndraḥ //
analyzed: vīja trayam vai punar api u pāsya sura ādhipatyam labhate muni indraḥ
translated: The lord of sages, again, will obtain lordship over the gods by repeating the three seed syllables.

original: punastathā kūrccayugaṃ japanti namanti siddhā narasiṃharūpāḥ /
analyzed: punar tathā kūrcca yugam japanti namanti siddhāḥ narasiṃha rūpāḥ
translated: Then, the Siddhas, in the form of Narasimha, repeat the two syllables kūrcca, and bow down.

analyzed: tatas api lajjā dvaya jāpaka tvāt labhanti siddhim manasaḥ janāḥ te
translated: Then, due to the repetition of the two syllables lajjā, those people attain the accomplishment of the mind.

original: ante padaṃ kṣipya vibhā vibhāvasostvanmantramuddhāramidaṃ vadanti //
analyzed: ante padam kṣipya vibhā vibhāvasoḥ tvad mantram uddhāram idam vadanti
translated: At the end, they say this is the extraction of your mantra, placing the syllable vibhā after the syllable vibhāvasa.

original: tripañcāre cakre janani / satataṃ siddhisahitāṃ vicinvan sañcinvan paramamamṛtaṃ
analyzed: tri pañca are cakre janani satatam siddhi sahitām vicinvan sañcinvan paramam amṛtam
translated: O Mother, always contemplating and collecting the supreme nectar in the wheel of fifteen spokes,

analyzed: dakṣiṇa padam
translated: placing the right foot.

original: sadā kālīṃ dhyātvā vidhivihitapūjāparikarā viśeṣākhyānaṃ te na khalu
analyzed: sadā kālīm dhyātvā vidhi vihita pūjā parikarāḥ viśeṣa ākhyānam te na khalu
translated: Always meditating on Kālī, with the offerings of worship prescribed by the rules, the special narration of your

original: bhavabhaṅgābhayapadaḥ //🔽tvaṃ śrīstvamīśvarī kālī tvaṃ hrīstvañca karālikā /
analyzed: bhava bhaṅga abhaya padaḥ  tvam śrīḥ tvam īśvarī kālī tvam hrīḥ tvam ca karālikā
translated: is not the abode of fear of the destruction of worldly existence.🔽You are Lakshmi, you are the Goddess Kali, you are Hri (modesty), and you are Karalika (the terrible one).

original: lajjā lakṣmīḥ satī gaurī nityācintyā citiḥ kriyā //
translated: You are Laja (barley grains), you are Lakshmi, you are Sati (chaste), you are Gauri (the fair one), you are Nitya (the eternal one), you are inconceivable, you are consciousness, and you are action.

original: parā ādyā parākhyā ca paramā paramā vasuḥ /
analyzed: parā ādyā parākhyā ca paramā paramā vasuḥ
translated: The first supreme, called supreme, the supreme, the supreme wealth,

original: akulyādyaiścitte pracayapadapadyaiḥ padayutaiḥ sadā japtvā stutvā japati hṛdi mantraṃ
analyzed: akulyā ādyaiḥ citte pracaya pada padyaiḥ pada yutaiḥ sadā japtvā stutvā japati hṛdi mantram
translated: Having always recited the mantra in the heart with the mind, having praised with the words of the collection of syllables and feet, along with the feet, with the first of the unmanifest,

analyzed: manu vidā
translated: By one who knows the mantra.

original: p / na teṣāṃ saṃsāre vibhavaparibhaṅgapramathane kṣaṇaṃ cittaṃ devi / prabhavati
analyzed: na teṣām saṃsāre vibhava paribhaṅga pramathane kṣaṇam cittam devi prabhavati
translated: O Goddess, their mind is not for a moment in the destruction of wealth in worldly existence,

analyzed: viruddhe parikaram
translated: In the opposite, the preparation.

original: trayastriṃśaiḥ ślokairyadi japati mantraṃ stavati ca nameccaitānetān paramamṛtakalpaṃ
analyzed: trayastriṃśaiḥ ślokaiḥ yadi japati mantram stavati ca namet ca etān etān param amṛta kalpam
translated: If one recites the mantra with thirty-three verses, and praises and bows to these, this is like the highest nectar,

analyzed: sura varam
translated: The best of gods.

original: bhavet siddhiḥ śuddhau jagati śirasā tvatpadayugaṃ praṇamya prākāmyaṃ varasurajanaiḥ
analyzed: bhavet siddhiḥ śuddhau jagati śirasā tvad pada yugam praṇamya prākāmyam vara sura janaiḥ
translated: If one bows one's head to your two feet in the world of purity, one will attain success, and the best of gods will worship

analyzed: pūjya vitatim
translated: And spread out the desired boon.

original: iti viśvasāratantre dakṣiṇakālikākramastotraṃ nāma caturthaḥ paṭalaḥ //
analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre dakṣiṇakālikākramastotram nāma caturthaḥ paṭalaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth chapter named the praise of the sequence of Dakshina Kalika in the Vishvasara Tantra.

original: yāsāṃ yāsāṃ kramastotraṃ tāsāṃ tāsāṃ dakṣiṇāprakṛtikatvenāpavādaviṣayam
analyzed: yāsām yāsām krama stotram tāsām tāsām dakṣiṇā prakṛtika tvena apavāda viṣayam
translated: The praise of the sequence of those and those, being of the nature of the southern Prakruti, is the subject of exception,

analyzed: parityajya utsargasya pravṛtti tvāt dakṣiṇa kālikā krama stotra pāṭhena eva tad phala nirvāhaḥ
translated: Abandoning the application of the general rule, the fulfillment of that result is by the recitation of the praise of the sequence of Dakshina Kalika alone.

original: samprati guhyakālyā api viśeṣa uktastatraiva ṣaṣṭhapaṭale tatkavacāt param //
analyzed: samprati guhyakālyāḥ api viśeṣaḥ uktaḥ tatra eva ṣaṣṭha paṭale tad kavacāt param
translated: Now, a special (teaching) concerning Guhyakali is also stated there in the sixth chapter, after her armor.

analyzed: krama stavam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: I will speak the Krama hymn, listen, O lotus-faced one.

analyzed: brāhmye muhūrte utthāya guru devān namet sadā
translated: Rising at Brahma's hour, one should always bow to the guru and the gods.

analyzed: vāruṇī mukham āśritya namaskuryāt upari adhas
translated: Relying on the mouth of Varuni, one should bow above and below.

analyzed: gurubhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam namaḥ tad pādukāya ca
translated: One should always bow to the gurus and to their sandals.

original: paraṃ parebhyaśca parāparebhyaḥ parātparebhyo'pi namo'stu te ca /🔽ādhāraśaktiṃ namaskṛtya kulācalānnamaskuryyāt /
analyzed: param parebhyaḥ ca parāparebhyaḥ parātparebhyaḥ pi namaḥ astu te ca  ādhāra śaktim namaskṛtya kula acalān namaskuryyāt
translated: Salutations to you who are supreme among the supreme, the highest among the highest, and higher than the highest.🔽Having bowed to the foundation power, one should bow to the Kula mountains.

analyzed: dharmma karmmaṇe namaskṛtya kūrmma rājāya vai namaḥ
translated: Having bowed to Dharma Karma, salutations to the king of tortoises.

original: anantāya namo nityaṃ varāhāya namo namaḥ /
analyzed: anantāya namaḥ nityam varāhāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to Ananta, salutations again and again to Varaha.

original: pṛthivyai ca namo nityaṃ kulācalebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthivyai ca namaḥ nityam kula acalebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the earth, salutations again and again to the Kula mountains.

analyzed: samudrebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam sa ratnaiḥ amṛtaiḥ jalaiḥ
translated: Salutations always to the oceans with their jewels, nectar, and waters.

original: kulavṛkṣebhyo namo nityaṃ kalpavṛkṣebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: kula vṛkṣebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam kalpavṛkṣebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Kula trees, salutations again and again to the wish-fulfilling trees.

analyzed: svarṇa siṃhāsanebhyaḥ ca maṇi vedyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: And salutations to the golden lion thrones, salutations again and again to the jeweled lamps.

original: caturdiśi namaskuryyāt sarvadevān namastataḥ /🔽vedebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ vedārthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: catur diśi namaskuryyāt sarva devān namaḥ tatas  vedebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam veda arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should bow down in the four directions, and then pay homage to all the gods.🔽One should always pay homage to the Vedas, and also to the meanings of the Vedas.

original: śākhābhyastasya vai nityaṃ tatpādebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: śākhābhyaḥ tasya vai nityam tad pādebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the branches of the Vedas, and also to their feet.

original: tadvarṇebhyo namo nityaṃ varṇārthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tad varṇebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam varṇa arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to their letters, and also to the meanings of the letters.

analyzed: a saṃskāra padebhyaḥ ca namaḥ vai paramātmane
translated: One should pay homage to the stages of spiritual development, and also to the Supreme Self.

analyzed: vidyābhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam avidyābhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the branches of knowledge, and also to the non-branches of knowledge.

analyzed: śāstrebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam aśāstrebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the scriptures, and also to the non-scriptures.

original: dharmebhyo'pi namo nityamadharmebhyo namo namaḥ /🔽bhāgavatebhyo namo nityaṃ vidyābhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: dharmebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam adharmebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  bhāgavatebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam vidyābhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the righteous, and also to the unrighteous.🔽One should always pay homage to the devotees of Lord Vishnu, and also to the branches of knowledge.

original: p / śrutibhyo'pi namo nityaṃ śrutyarthebhyo namo namaḥ /🔽śrīrāmabhāgavatebhyaśca daṇḍavat praṇamet sadā /
analyzed: śrutibhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam śruti arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  śrī rāma bhāgavatebhyaḥ ca daṇḍa vat praṇamet sadā
translated: One should always pay homage to the Vedas, and also to the meanings of the Vedas.

original: bhāgavatebhyo namo nityaṃ bhāgavatārthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: bhāgavatebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam bhāgavata arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the Srimad Bhagavatam, and also to the Srimad Bhagavatam.

original: tattvārthebhyo namo nityaṃ tattvebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tattva arthebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tattvebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the meanings of the truth, and also to the truths.

original: yogebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ yogārthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: yogebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam yoga arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always pay homage to the yogas, and also to the meanings of the yogas.

original: saṃhitābhyo namo nityaṃ tadarthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: saṃhitābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tad arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Samhitas, salutations again and again to their meanings.

original: mātṛkābhyo namo nityaṃ tadarthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: mātṛkābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tad arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Matrikas, salutations again and again to their meanings.

original: kalābhyo'pi namo nityaṃ śaktibhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: kalābhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam śaktibhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations also to the Kalas, salutations again and again to the Shaktis.

original: svarebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ rāgebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: svarebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam rāgebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Svaras, salutations again and again to the Ragas.

original: rāgiṇībhyo namo nityaṃ tadarthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: rāgiṇībhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tad arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the Raginis, salutations again and again to their meanings.

original: astrebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ śastrebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /🔽jīvebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ vījebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: astrebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam śastrebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ  jīvebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam vījebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the weapons, salutations again and again to the missiles.🔽Salutations always to the living beings, salutations again and again to the seeds.

original: bhūcarebhyo namo nityaṃ khecarebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: bhū carebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam khecarebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the earth-wanderers, salutations again and again to the sky-wanderers.

original: yogebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ karaṇebhyo namo namaḥ /🔽muhūrtebhyo namo nityaṃ yāmebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: yogebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam karaṇebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  muhūrtebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam yāmebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the yogas, salutations again and again to the instruments.🔽Salutations always to the muhurtas, salutations again and again to the yamas.

original: ṛtubhyo'pi namo nityaṃ vatsarebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtubhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam vatsarebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the seasons, salutations again and again to the years.

original: ḍākinībhyo namo nityaṃ rudrebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /🔽bhūtebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ pretebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: ḍākinībhyaḥ namaḥ nityam rudrebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ  bhūtebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam pretebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the dakinis, salutations again and again to the Rudras.🔽Salutations always to the bhutas, salutations again and again to the pretas.

original: yakṣebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ vighnebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: yakṣebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam vighnebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the yakshas, salutations again and again to the obstacles.

original: bhūtebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ mahābhūtebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: bhūtebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam mahābhūtebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the elements, salutations to the great elements.

original: ācāryebhyo namo nityaṃ śaṅkarebhyo namo namaḥ /🔽vaiṣṇavebhyo namo nityaṃ ye ca māyāvimohitāḥ /
analyzed: ācāryebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam śaṅkarebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  vaiṣṇavebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam ye ca māyā vimohitāḥ
translated: Salutations always to the teachers, salutations to the benevolent ones.🔽Salutations always to the devotees of Vishnu, and to those who are deluded by Maya.

original: māyāyai praṇamennityaṃ prattvebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /🔽śarīrebhyo namo nityaṃ vyāpakebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: māyāyai praṇamet nityam namaḥ namaḥ  śarīrebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam vyāpakebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: One should always bow to Maya, and salutations to the Pracetas.🔽Salutations always to the bodies, salutations to the all-pervading ones.

original: mantrebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ yantrārthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: mantrebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam yantra arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the mantras, salutations to the instruments.

analyzed: namaḥ varṇa ātmikābhyaḥ ca devatābhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the deities in the form of letters, salutations to the deities.

original: tatpadebhyo namo nityaṃ satpadebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tad padebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam sat padebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to those words, salutations to the true words.

original: bhāvanābhyo namo nityaṃ bhāvaśāstrebhya eva ca /
analyzed: bhāvanābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam bhāva śāstrebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: Salutations always to the contemplations, and to the treatises on emotions.

original: stavebhyaḥ kavacebhyaśca nāmabhyo'pi namo namaḥ /🔽āgamebhyo namo nityaṃ tadarthebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: stavebhyaḥ kavacebhyaḥ ca nāmabhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ  āgamebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam tad arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the hymns, to the armours, and also to the names.🔽Salutations always to the scriptures, salutations to their meanings.

original: tatkriyābhyo namo nityaṃ śreṣṭhaśāstreti kīrttyate /🔽rasebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ gandhebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tad kriyābhyaḥ namaḥ nityam śreṣṭha śāstra iti kīrttyate  rasebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam gandhebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to their actions, it is proclaimed as the best treatise.🔽Salutations always to the juices, salutations to the fragrances.

original: p / pīṭhebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ tatsthebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: pīṭhebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam tad sthebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the seats, salutations to those who are seated.

original: sattvebhyo'pi namo nityaṃ rājasebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: sattvebhyaḥ api namaḥ nityam rājasebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the sattva-natured ones, salutations to the rajas-natured ones,

original: tāmasebhyo namo nityaṃ guṇebhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tāmasebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam guṇebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the tamas-natured ones, salutations to the qualities.

analyzed: sarva vidyā avatārebhyaḥ siddhebhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to all the vidya-holders, salutations to the siddhas.

analyzed: ānanda kandāya namaskṛtya kandanāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Having bowed to the bliss-filled root, salutations to the root.

analyzed: sarva tattva ātma kamalāya prakṛti patrebhyaḥ eva ca
translated: To the lotus that is the nature of all reality, and to the petals of prakriti,

analyzed: siddha pīṭhāya sattvasya śava rūpa śivāya ca
translated: To the siddha-seat, to the sattva, to Shiva in the form of a shava,

original: tripañcārāya cakrāya namo nityaṃ namo namaḥ /
analyzed: tri pañca ārāya cakrāya namaḥ nityam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the wheel of fifteen and three, salutations always, again and again.

analyzed: tatrasthāyai kālikāyai guhyāyai kāmarūpiṇyai
translated: To Kalika who resides there, to the secret one who assumes any form,

analyzed: guru kula ādi śaktibhyaḥ kālikāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the shaktis of the guru's lineage, salutations again and again to Kalika.

original: namo namo namaste'stu parāparābhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ namaḥ teḥ tu parāparābhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations, salutations, salutations to you, salutations to the supreme and the inferior.

analyzed: viśāla netrām sura saṅgha vanditām sura asura abhyarccita pāda padmām
translated: The one with large eyes, worshipped by the hosts of gods, whose lotus feet are revered by gods and demons,

analyzed: nṛ muṇḍa mālā kalitā śata aṅgaiḥ parāvare te prabhavanti siddhāḥ
translated: The siddhas who are beyond the highest and the lowest are adorned with a garland of a hundred human skulls.

original: sthūle kecit pravadanti siddhāḥ sūkṣmeti kecinmunayo vadanti /
analyzed: sthūle kecid pravadanti siddhāḥ sūkṣmā iti kecid munayaḥ vadanti
translated: Some siddhas say it is gross, some sages say it is subtle.

analyzed: tām ambikām naumi viśāla netra su maṅgalam dhehi madīya dehe
translated: I bow to that Ambika, grant me the great auspiciousness in my body.

analyzed: tvadīya pāda ambujam evam etat niṣevya siddhāḥ prabhavam prayānti
translated: The Siddhas attain the highest state by serving this lotus feet of yours.

analyzed: mātar tava ayam pāpāt sarva śoka duḥkhāt jagat jana ramye
translated: O Mother, this world is dear to you, free from all sorrow and misery.

original: ye tvā dhyāyeyurmanasi vidhānāḥ sarve te sakalaphalāḥ //
analyzed: ye tvā dhyāyeyuḥ manasi vidhānāḥ sarve te sakala phalāḥ
translated: All those who meditate on you in the mind, they all attain all the fruits.

original: iti viśvasāratantre guhyakālyāḥ kramastavo nāma ṣaṣṭhapaṭale //
analyzed: iti viśvasāratantre guhyakālyāḥ kramastavaḥ nāma ṣaṣṭha paṭale
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter named The Praise of the Sequence of the Secret Kali in the Tantra of Universal Confidence.

analyzed: atha tripurāsundaryyāḥ krama stavaḥ saptama paṭale
translated: Now, in the seventh chapter, the praise of the sequence of Tripura Sundari.

analyzed: krama stavam pravakṣyāmi śṛṇuṣva kamalānane
translated: I will speak the praise of the sequence, listen, O lotus-faced one.

original: oṃ gurubhyo namo nityaṃ parātparatarāya ca /
analyzed: om gurubhyaḥ namaḥ nityam parātparatarāya ca
translated: Om, salutations always to the Gurus, to the one beyond the supreme,

original: parāparebhyaḥ parebhyaśca namo nityaṃ namo namaḥ /
analyzed: para aparebhyaḥ parebhyaḥ ca namaḥ nityam namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the supreme, to the higher than the supreme, salutations always, again and again.

original: gobhyo namo brāhmaṇebhyo brahmaputrebhyo vai namaḥ /
analyzed: gobhyaḥ namaḥ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ brahma putrebhyaḥ vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the cows, to the Brahmins, salutations to the sons of Brahma,

analyzed: munibhyaḥ muni patnībhyaḥ muni putrebhyaḥ vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the sages, to the wives of the sages, salutations to the sons of the sages.

original: digbhyo namo dikpatibhyo digambarebhyaśca vai namaḥ /
analyzed: digbhyaḥ namaḥ dikpatibhyaḥ digambarebhyaḥ ca vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the directions, to the lords of the directions, and salutations to the naked ones in the directions.

original: bhramaṇebhyo namo nityaṃ rasanābhyaśca vai namaḥ /
analyzed: bhramaṇebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam rasanābhyaḥ ca vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the wanderers, and salutations to the tongues.

analyzed: vedebhyaḥ veda śāstrebhyaḥ veda arthebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the Vedas, to the Vedangas, and to the meanings of the Vedas.

original: bhāgavatebhyo namo nityaṃ śrībhāgavatebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: bhāgavatebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam śrī bhāgavatebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the devotees of the Lord, salutations again and again to the devotees of the glorious Bhagavat.

original: śrīrāmabhāgatebhyo namo nityaṃ bhāgavatebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: śrī rāma bhāga tebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam bhāgavatebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the devotees of Sri Rama, salutations again and again to the devotees of the Lord.

analyzed: tīrthebhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ ca pīṭhebhyaḥ satatam namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the holy places, to the mountains, and to the sacred seats.

analyzed: yogibhyaḥ yoginībhyaḥ ca yoga ādibhyaḥ ca vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the yogis, to the yoginis, and to the practices of yoga.

original: p / dhyānebhyo mantravarṇebhyo mātṛkābhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: dhyānebhyaḥ mantra varṇebhyaḥ mātṛkābhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the meditations, to the mantras, to the alphabet, and to the mother goddesses.

original: ācāryyebhyo namo nityaṃ bhairavebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryyebhyaḥ namaḥ nityam bhairavebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations always to the spiritual teachers, salutations again and again to the Bhairavas.

analyzed: rudrebhyaḥ rudra patnībhyaḥ gandharvebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the Rudras, to the wives of Rudra, and to the Gandharvas.

original: kinnarebhyaḥ piśācebhyaḥ kuṣmāṇḍebhyo namo namaḥ /🔽avatārebhyo mūrttibhya ādityebhyo namo namaḥ /
analyzed: kinnarebhyaḥ piśācebhyaḥ kuṣmāṇḍebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  avatārebhyaḥ mūrttibhyaḥ ādityebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the Kinnaras, to the Pisacas, and to the Kumbhandas.🔽Salutations again and again to the incarnations, to the forms, and to the suns.

original: namaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaśca divasebhyo namo namaḥ /🔽nakṣatragrahayogebhyaḥ karaṇebhyaśca vai namaḥ /🔽tithibhyaḥ sarvakālebhya ṛtubhyo'pi namo namaḥ /
analyzed: namaḥ saṃvatsarebhyaḥ ca divasebhyaḥ namaḥ namaḥ  nakṣatra graha yogebhyaḥ karaṇebhyaḥ ca vai namaḥ  tithibhyaḥ sarva kālebhyaḥ ṛtubhyaḥ api namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the years, and salutations again and again to the days.🔽Salutations to the conjunctions of the stars and planets, and to the Karana periods.🔽Salutations to the lunar days, to all times, and to the seasons.

analyzed: kakāra ādyaiḥ mahādevyai kālikāyai namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the great goddess Kali, whose name begins with the letter ka.

analyzed: ekāra sthām mahādevīm sarva ādhāra svarūpiṇīm
translated: The great goddess residing in the letter e, the embodiment of all support,

analyzed: īkāra sthām mahādevīm ratim kāma aṅga sundarīm
translated: The great goddess residing in the letter i, Rati, the beautiful limb of Kama,
For the attainment of all accomplishments, to the great goddess residing in the letter la, Indrani,

analyzed: hakāra stha mahādevyai śivāyai sarvatas namaḥ
translated: To the great goddess residing in the letter ha, to Shiva, salutations from all sides.

analyzed: etaiḥ varṇaiḥ mahāmāyā pātu mām sundarī śubhā
translated: May the auspicious Sundari, the great Maya, protect me with these letters.

original: sakārasthā mahāmāyā sāvitrī pātu māṃ sadā /🔽śiva māṃ pātu deveśī hakārādyā sureśvarī /
analyzed: sakāra sthā mahāmāyā sāvitrī pātu mām sadā  śiva mām pātu deveśī hakāra ādyā sureśvarī
translated: May the great Maya, Savitri, always protect me, residing in the letter sa.🔽May Shiva, the goddess of gods, the chief of gods beginning with the letter ha, always protect me.

analyzed: śivānī sarvadā pātu hakāra sthā mahā udayā
translated: May Shiva, residing in the letter ha, the greatly prosperous one, always protect me.

original: vakārasthā mahādevī pātu māṃ kāmadāyinī /🔽lakārasthā makudevī indrāṇī pātu sarvadā /
analyzed: vakāra sthā mahādevī pātu mām kāma dāyinī
translated: May the great goddess residing in the letter va, the bestower of desires, always protect me.🔽May the goddess residing in the letter la, Indrani, always protect me.

original: sarvāṅgaṃ pātu māṃ devī sarvāṇī sarvasundarī /
analyzed: sarva aṅgam pātu mām devī sarvāṇī sarva sundarī
translated: May the goddess, the wife of Indra, the most beautiful of all, always protect all my limbs.

analyzed: etaiḥ varṇaiḥ mahāmāyā pātu mām sundarī sadā
translated: May the great Maya, Sundari, always protect me with these letters.

original: kakārasthā mahāmāyā brahmāṇī pātu māṃ sadā /
analyzed: kakāra sthā mahāmāyā brahmāṇī pātu mām sadā
translated: May the great Maya, Brahma, always protect me, residing in the letter ka.

analyzed: hakāra sthā śivā pātu sarvatra śiva dūtikā
translated: May Shiva, the messenger of peace everywhere, residing in the letter ha, always protect me.

analyzed: kakāra sthā śivā pātu hakāra sthā sureśvarī
translated: May Shiva, residing in the letter ka, the chief of gods residing in the letter ha,

analyzed: sakāra sthā sadā pātu sāvitrī śarma dāyinī
translated: May Savitri, the bestower of peace, always protect me, residing in the letter sa.

analyzed: lakāra sthā mahādevī lakṣmīḥ mām sarvadā avatu
translated: May the great goddess Lakshmi, residing in the letter La, always protect me.

original: bhuvaneśī sadā pātu sarvāṅge bhavasundarī /🔽anantā sarvadā pātu akārasthā sureśvarī /
analyzed: bhuvaneśī sadā pātu sarva aṅge bhavasundarī  anantā sarvadā pātu akāra sthā sureśvarī
translated: May Bhuvaneshvari, the beautiful Bhava, always protect all my limbs.🔽May the goddess of gods, Ananta, always protect me, residing in the letter A.

analyzed: akāra ādyā sadā pātu śivadūtī sureśvarī
translated: May the goddess of gods, Shiva's messenger, always protect me, beginning with the letter A.

analyzed: sakāra sthā sadā pātu kāminī kāma dāyinī
translated: May the giver of desires, Kamini, always protect me, residing in the letter Sa.

analyzed: lakāre pātu mām sarva kṣetre tribhuvaneśvarī
translated: May the goddess of the three worlds always protect me in all the sacred places, in the letter La.

original: lakārasthā sadā pātu indrāṇī sarvadā mama /
analyzed: lakāra sthā sadā pātu indrāṇī sarvadā mama
translated: May Indra's wife, always residing in the letter La, always protect me.

original: makārasthā sadā pātu sarvatra māṃ sureśvarī /
analyzed: makāra sthā sadā pātu sarvatra mām sureśvarī
translated: May the goddess of gods always protect me everywhere, residing in the letter Ma.

original: ebhirvarṇaiḥ sthitā devī pātu māṃ bhuvaneśvarī /
analyzed: ebhiḥ varṇaiḥ sthitā devī pātu mām bhuvaneśvarī
translated: May the goddess residing in these letters, Bhuvaneshvari, always protect me.

original: śivānī māṃ sadā pātu sarvatra harasundarī /
analyzed: śivānī mām sadā pātu sarvatra harasundarī
translated: May Shiva's wife, the beautiful Hara, always protect me everywhere.
The knowledge residing in the seed of the moon, Savitri, in the form of Shambhu,

original: p / pātu māṃ sarvakṣetreṣu devatā bhuvaneśvarī /
analyzed: pātu mām sarva kṣetreṣu devatā bhuvaneśvarī
translated: May the goddess of the three worlds, Bhuvaneshvari, always protect me in all the sacred places.

analyzed: etaiḥ varṇaiḥ mahāmāyā pañcaviṃśati varṇikā
translated: By these letters, the great Maya, consisting of twenty-five letters,

analyzed: bhuvaneśī sadā pātu sarva aṅge tripurāmbikā
translated: May Bhuvaneshvari, Tripura's mother, always protect all my limbs.

analyzed: sarva vījeṣu sarvatra yojayet bhuvaneśvarīm
translated: One should always add Bhuvaneshvari to all the seed mantras.

original: sarvāṅge māṃ sadā pātu devī tribhuvaneśvarī /
analyzed: sarva aṅge mām sadā pātu devī tribhuvana īśvarī
translated: May the goddess of the three worlds always protect all my limbs.

analyzed: śikhāyām bhrū yuge ca akṣṇoḥ oṣṭhayoḥ gaṇḍayoḥ nasi
translated: On the tuft of hair, on the pair of eyebrows, on the eyes, on the lips, on the cheeks, on the nose,

original: tathā ca civuke dante jihvāyāṃ tālumūlake /🔽hṛdaye pārśvayugale pṛṣṭhe nābhau tathodare /
analyzed: tathā ca civuke dante jihvāyām tālu mūlake  hṛdaye pārśva yugale pṛṣṭhe nābhau tathā udare
translated: And likewise on the chin, on the teeth, on the tongue, on the root of the palate,🔽On the heart, on the pair of sides, on the back, on the navel, and on the belly,

original: nitambe ca tathopasthe guhye ca jānuyugmake /
analyzed: nitambe ca tathā upasthe guhye ca jānu yugmake
translated: On the buttocks, and likewise on the genitals, on the secret parts, on the pair of knees,

original: jānucakre ca jaṅghāyāṃ kaṭike pādake punaḥ /
analyzed: jānu cakre ca jaṅghāyām kaṭike pādake punar
translated: On the knee-caps, on the shanks, on the hips, and again on the feet,

analyzed: sarva aṅge pātu mām devī śrīmat tripurasundarī
translated: May the glorious Goddess Tripura Sundari protect me in all the limbs.

original: śāstre vāde ca saṃgrāme rājadvāre surārccane /🔽prāntare giridurge ca śatrumadhye tathāpare /

original: gāyatryāḥ prathamaṃ bījaṃ pūjāsthāne nyaset sudhīḥ /
analyzed: gāyatryāḥ prathamam bījam pūjā sthāne nyaset sudhīḥ

original: sāmānyārghyaṃ tataḥ kuryyāt pūrvoktakramavartmanā /🔽p / gāyatrīṃ saṃkṛduccāryya tāmrapātre jalaṃ kṣipet /
analyzed: sāmānya arghyam tatas kuryyāt pūrva ukta krama vartmanā  gāyatrīm saṃkṛt uccārya tāmra pātre jalam kṣipet

analyzed: tīrtham āvāhya yatnena gāyatrīm prajapet tatas
translated: Having invoked the sacred place with effort, one should then chant Gayatri.

analyzed: tatas dhenvā amṛtīkṛtya prathama aṣṭa akṣareṇa vai
translated: Then, having made the cow immortal with the first eight-syllabled mantra,

analyzed: dvitīya aṣṭa akṣare vipraḥ jalam vīkṣya praśāntaye

analyzed: tṛtīya aṣṭa akṣare devi jalaiḥ ātma viśodhanam
translated: With the third eight-syllabled mantra, O Goddess, one should purify oneself with water.

analyzed: anena eva vidhānena sṛṣṭi sthiti laya ātmakam
translated: By this very method, the worship consisting of creation, sustenance, and dissolution,

analyzed: pūjanam parameśāni tadā eva phala dāyakam

original: yantranyāsadhyānādikantu pūrvameva likhitam //🔽sauraṃ pīṭhaṃ yajettatra dīptādinavaśaktibhiḥ /

analyzed: tatra sarvatobhadra maṇḍale dīpta ādayaḥ tu caturdaśa paṭale
translated: There, in the Sarvatobhadra mandala, Dipta and others are mentioned in the fourteenth chapter.

analyzed: yathā

analyzed: dīptā sūkṣmā jayā bhadrā vibhūtiḥ vimalā punar
translated: Dipta, Sukshma, Jaya, Bhadra, Vibhuti, Vimal,

analyzed: aghorā vidyutā sarvatomukhī pīṭha śaktayaḥ

analyzed: saura pīṭham sūrya prakaraṇena anusandheyam

analyzed: mūlamantreṇa kḷptāyām mūrttau devīm prapūjayet

analyzed: nirvāṇatantre
translated: In the Nirvanatantra:

analyzed: jīva nyāsa ādikam kṛtvā pūjayet tām trivarga dām

analyzed: hālāhala ādikam mantram samastam parameśvari
translated: The entire mantra beginning with Halahala, O Supreme Goddess.

original: samuccāryya vadet pādyaṃ sāvitrīṃ ṅeyutāṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: samuccāryya vadet pādyam sāvitrīm ṅeyutām tatas

analyzed: tyāga ātmaka manum paścāt yathā vibhava vistaraiḥ

analyzed: pūjayet bahu yatnena ca anyathā brāhmaṇaḥ smṛtaḥ

analyzed: śāradāyām
translated: In the Sharada Tantra it is said:

analyzed: āditya ādyāḥ tatas pūjyāḥ ūṣa ādi sahitāḥ kramāt

analyzed: āditya ādyāḥ ca ūṣa ādayaḥ ca sūryya prakaraṇe veditavyāḥ
translated: The Adityas and Ushas should be known in the context of the Sun.

analyzed: kānti durgā sarasvatyau vidyā rūpāḥ tatas param
translated: Then, Kanti, Durga, Saraswati, and Vidyarupa,

analyzed: viśālā sahitām īśām vyāpinīm vimalām japet

original: tamo'pahāriṇīṃ sūkṣmāṃ viśvayoniṃ jayāvahām /🔽padmālayāṃ parāṃ śobhāṃ padmarūpāṃ tato'rccayet /
analyzed: tama upahāriṇīm sūkṣmām viśva yonim jaya āvahām  padmālayām parām śobhām padma rūpām tatas ūrccayet

analyzed: brāhmī ādyāḥ sa aruṇāḥ vāhye pūjayet prokta lakṣaṇāḥ

analyzed: tatas abhyarccet grahān vāhye śakrāṃdīn āyudhaiḥ saha
translated: Then one should worship the planets outside along with Indra and other weapons.

analyzed: ittham āvaraṇaiḥ devīm daśabhiḥ paripūjayet

analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣāṇām bhoktā syāt dvijasattamaḥ
translated: The best of Brahmins becomes the enjoyer of Dharma, Artha, Kama and Moksha.

analyzed: nirvāṇatantre
translated: In the Nirvanatantra.

analyzed: dravya abhāve varārohe pādya ādyaiḥ udaka ātmakaiḥ
translated: O beautiful lady, in the absence of substances, with water-based offerings like water for washing the feet,

analyzed: pūjayitvā japet devīm gāyatrīm paramākṣarīm
translated: having worshipped the Goddess, one should recite the Gayatri, the supreme syllable.

original: p / etena dravyābhāve jalādinā pūjāyāṃ karttavyāyāmapi
analyzed: etena dravya abhāve jala ādinā pūjāyām karttavyāyām api
translated: By this, even when worship is to be performed with water etc. in the absence of substances,

analyzed: etat pādyam ityādi vaktavyam atas eva smṛtiḥ

original: tailaṃ pratinidhiṃ kuryyād yajñārthe yājñiko yadi /
analyzed: tailam pratinidhim kuryyāt yajña arthe yājñikaḥ yadi

analyzed: prakṛtyā eva tadā hetoḥ brūyāt ghṛtavatīm iti

analyzed: tena etat pādya artham jalam iti vākyam anuśāsana viruddham iti
translated: Therefore, the statement this water is for washing the feet is contrary to the injunction.

analyzed: japa phalam api tatra eva
translated: The fruit of Japa is also stated there itself.

analyzed: daśabhiḥ janma janitam śatena api purā kṛtam

analyzed: tri janma jam sahasreṇa gāyatrī hanti pātakam
translated: by a thousand (recitations), Gayatri destroys the sins born of three births.

analyzed: jape tu viśeṣaḥ uktaḥ gāyatrītantre

analyzed: gāyatryā puṭitam kṛtvā iṣṭa mantram japet śatam

original: iṣṭamantreṇa puṭitaṃ gāyatrīṃ prajapecchatam /🔽etajjapaṃ maheśāni / ādhārādheyamuttamam /
analyzed: iṣṭa mantreṇa puṭitam gāyatrīm prajapet śatam  etat japam maheśāni ādhāra ādheyam uttamam
translated: One should repeat the Gayatri mantra one hundred times, combined with the desired mantra.🔽This repetition, O Mahesani, is the excellent support and the supported.

analyzed: vinā ādhāram maheśāni ādheyena vinā tathā
translated: Without support, O Mahesani, and likewise without the supported,

analyzed: na ādhāram sidhyate bhadre ādheyam ca na sidhyati  sarveṣu viṣṇu mantreṣu saura gāṇapatau tathā
translated: The support is not accomplished, O fortunate one, and the supported is not accomplished.🔽In all Vishnu mantras, and also in the Sun and Ganapati mantras,

analyzed: ādhāra ādheya bhāvaḥ tu sarvatra karavarṇini
translated: The state of support and supported is described everywhere, O lady of beautiful limbs.

analyzed: sa aṅganāt locanāt yaḥ tu jhaṭiti praviśet gṛham

analyzed: evam ādhāram ādheyam yaḥ karoti dvijātikaḥ

original: aṅkuro jāyate bhadre / lakṣajāpānnaṃ saṃśayaḥ /🔽naca jīvātmanorbhinnā gāyatrī brahmarūpiṇī /

translated: A sprout is born, O fortunate one, there is no doubt, from a hundred thousand repetitions.🔽The Gayatri, which is in the form of Brahman, is not different from the individual soul.

original: gāyatrī na hi bhinnā syājjīvātmā tatsvarūpiṇī /
analyzed: gāyatrī na hi bhinnā syāt jīvātmā tad svarūpiṇī
translated: The Gayatri should not be different, the individual soul is in its form.

analyzed: sarvadā ubhayoḥ aikyam nārikele yathā udakam

original: dvijātiḥ kathyate devabhāva eva hi brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: dvijātiḥ kathyate deva bhāvaḥ eva hi brāhmaṇaḥ

analyzed: yathā sparśamaṇi sparśāt tāmrā upi kāñcanam sadā
translated: Just as copper, though touched by a touchstone, is always gold,

analyzed: gāyatrī sahitaḥ ātmā dvijātmā tena īritaḥ

analyzed: gayatrītantre
translated: In the Gayatri Tantra.

original: japet sūryyamukho vipro nāsti diṅniyamaḥ kvacit /
analyzed: japet sūryya mukhaḥ vipraḥ na asti diś niyamaḥ kvacid

analyzed: gāyatrīm prajapet nityam trisandhyam na atra saṃśayaḥ

original: aśauce tu maheśāni / gāyatrīṃ manasā smaret /

analyzed: śrī devī uvāca

analyzed: śrī devadevaḥ uvāca

The wife of the supreme Brahman, having the form of fifty letters,

analyzed: nityam tiṣṭhatu sa ānandā kuṇḍalī bhava vigrahe
